descendants.content: @breadandcircuses I really wish this stuff was phrased better. The danger of heat waves is extreme increases in heat from normal levels. Nomany seems to take European heatwaves seriously in places like Australia because their heatwaves are our normal summer temps. But it's the *change* in temp from the levels before that is dangerous. It doesn't matter where you live in the world, global warming increases the sporadicness and extremity of weather events. This means that heat waves (jumps in temperature compared to temperature levels before the heat wave) are becoming more extreme. The fundemental danger of overheating is because bodies can't adapt to the sudden increase in heat, not because it is hot itself. Just because one heatwave is in the 30's and one is in the 40's doesn't make the one in the 40's more dangerous, it depends what the temps were before the heatwave. Heatwaves are bad everywhere for everymany due to global warming!
